Air Traffic
This airship is far from aero-plain!
空中交通
这飞船离飞机差的远！

Ah, the open skies. Once mankind's greatest unconquered adventure, now just the place you go when you're on your way to Disneyland inside a giant hunk of metal. But still, there's so much magic about being up in the air, looking down in awe on the miniature mountains and rivers below you, wondering how Earth can be so big, and yet so tiny.
啊，长空万里。曾是人类最大未征服的探险，现在仅仅是你前往迪士尼乐园时乘坐的大铁疙瘩飞向的地方。但是，浮于云上鸟瞰山脉星罗棋布、河流绵延流长、畅想地球之大，仍然有着吸引我们的魔力。

But if it's so wonderful to be on the inside of an aeroplane looking out, why can't it be just as wonderful from the outside looking in? Look, I'll say what we're all thinking: planes are just a bit boring. They're just big long grey tubes. Where's the colour? The innovation? The excitement?
但如果坐在飞机里向外瞭望是一件很美好的事，那么在外部探视其中为什么不可以是同样的美好呢？看吧，我们都这么想：飞机就是有一点无聊了，它们只是长长的灰色管子。色彩何在？创新何在？惊喜何在？

Our fantastical builders in the world of Minecraft have the right idea: fish-shaped pirate ships in the sky, hot air balloons, and now – courtesy of Mr Nov.oa – we have big-bellied steampunk airships, too! None of this dull grey in these builds, oh no: Mr Nov.oa's striking aircraft combines a lovely rusted orange, made using terracotta, with vivid, neon green accents made of lime glass and concrete.
我们 Minecraft 世界中富有幻想的建筑师有着正确的想法鱼形海盗船，热气球(已译)，还有现在 - 承蒙 Mr Nov.oa，我们也有大肚子蒸汽朋克飞船了！不，这些建筑里没有那些愚钝的灰：Nov.oa 引人注目的飞船融合了一种可爱的锈蚀的橙色，使用陶瓦制成；还带有一抹生动的莹绿，它们来自浅绿色玻璃和混凝土。



Look closely and you'll see the kind of detail we don't see in aeroplanes, too – probably because of boring reasons like "safety" and "aerodynamics". Mr Nov.oa's ship has no time for these things, and so you'll perhaps notice that there's a traffic light on its side, and some large windmill-things sticking out the back. These are actually propellers which keep the ship in place while it's flying, like a helicopter! No word on what the traffic light does, though.
再靠近点，你能看到一些我们在普通飞机上看不到的细节 - 大概是因为那些无聊的“安全性”和“空气动力学”之类的原因吧。Nov.oa 的船可没时间考虑这些，因此你可能注意到了它侧面的那些交通信号灯，以及背后伸出的那些大风车样的东西。这些实际上是螺旋桨，它们让飞船保持在空中飞行，如同直升机！尽管如此，没有对侧面交通灯的文字说明。

Mr Nov.oa spends most of his time building "animals, people and fantastic beings," which you can check out in this incredible album. Organic builds can be difficult, because they're not very symmetrical, like buildings are, and often require a lot more study of colour and shape. For Mr Nov.oa, the non-organic airship build was a challenge, because of his experience with building creatures. "I decided on airships because I wanted to try different things," he says, "and because I love the designs of the machinery." 
Nov.oa 花费绝大部分时间在构建“动物、人群和奇妙的生物”上，你可以在这个难以置信的专辑中见到它们。有机体的建造可以说很难，因为它们没有如建筑般的对称性，常常需要花费更多时间学习颜色和形状。对 Nov.oa 来说，非有机的飞船的建造是一个挑战，原因是他建造生物的经验。“我决定建造飞船是因为我想试点不同的东西，”他说道，“也源自我对机械设计的喜爱。”







He began his build by searching for inspiration, eventually finding an image of a steampunk airship with a traffic light sticking out of it. Mr Nov.oa then began to create the ship by hand, using the image as a guide. He began in June 2018 and finished it in March 2019 – a total of nine months. "I was very busy with other projects," he admits, "as well as studies and personal things that made it take me a long time to complete the project." 
他搜寻灵感以开始他的建筑，最终找到了一张有着伸出交通信号灯的蒸汽朋克飞船的图片。Nov.oa 接着着手创造飞船，以图片作为导向。他自 18 年六月始，至 19 年三月止 - 是整整九个月。“我忙于其他项目，”他承认，“学业和个人的私事也是让我这么久才完成它的原因。”

He says there were many challenging details in the build that contributed to it taking so long, too, from the propellers to the turbines, but most of all, the main engine, which is actually the bit he started on first. 
他还说，建筑中有许多富有挑战的细节让他投出大量时间，从那些螺旋桨到涡轮机，但耗时最多的，是主引擎，实际上也是他最先开始建造的部分。



Although the airship is a beautiful creation, it doesn't seem like Mr Nov.oa is totally won over to the non-organic side of Minecraft builds. "I like to make giant animals or fantastic beings," he says. "I love the combination of the idea of fantastic beings with nature." 
尽管飞船是一个美丽的创造，但 Nov.oa 并不像是完全投向了无机的 Minecraft 建筑一边。“我喜欢制作巨型动物和奇妙的生物，”他说。“我喜欢奇妙生物与自然的结合。”

Two of his three favourite builds are more in the natural style: one is [url=https://twitter.com/MrNov.oa_/status/946123488133201920]a creature that's part wolf, part tree[/url], and another is a glistening white structure that he calls [url=https://twitter.com/MrNov.oa_/status/1062832530125074433]"Dream of Paradise"[/url]. The third favourite, of course, is the airship, but after finishing this one, Mr Nov.oa intends to take a break from mechanical and technical builds. His next planned project? A citadel!
他最爱的三个建筑中的两个都更偏向自然：一个半狼半树的生物，另一个是闪闪发光的白色结构，他称之为“梦之天堂”，而第三个，自然是飞船。但在完成该作后，他打算让自己暂时远离机械和科技的建筑。他的下一个计划？一个堡垒！





It may be a few years before we can look up at the real-world clouds and see aircraft like Mr Nov.oa's steampunk creation, Whether that's because **s we have work perfectly fine, or because Mr Nov.oa's creation isn't exactly up to safety specifications, we'll never know. For now, at least, we can dream in blocks.
可能还要许多年，我们才能在仰望白云时见到如 Nov.oa 的蒸汽朋克创作一般的飞机，这可能是因为我们现有的已经足够好，也可能是 Nov.oa 的创作达不到安全规范，我们无从得知。但现在，至少我们能于方块中徜徉。
